description: Locations visited by Craig Spencer, a Manhattan doctor who has tested positive for Ebola.
title: What the New York City Ebola Patient Was Doing Before He Was Hospitalized
title_page: What the New York City Ebola Patient Was Doing Before He Was Hospitalized - The New York Times
maintext: Shortly after 1 p.m., he arrived at 6 Bellevue Hospital Center. He is being treated in one of four isolation rooms in the infectious disease ward on the seventh floor, which have been designated for high-probability or confirmed Ebola cases. The ward also has a laboratory to handle Ebola blood samples. His fiancée was also quarantined in the ward, while two friends who had extensive contact with him in recent days are being being quarantined separately. None of Dr. Spencer’s contacts have symptoms.
